heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour was the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 07 September 2025 and lasted 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (187°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 47.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 7.5°C) and outside temperature (down 6.0°C), more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 6%), and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 460 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1323 m), feels like temperature (up 7.1°C), outside temperature (up 5.4°C), and dew point temperature (up 2.3°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 460.5m lower than yesterday, 540.6m lower than the past week, 1323.0m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 1181m to 2400m and averaged 1138.2m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
